snippet: Support for same-sex marriage can spring up far from the coasts.
abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column describes a meeting he had with Marsha Ternus, the first woman ever to preside over the Iowa Supreme Court, which unanimously ruled that a statute banning same-sex marriage in the state was unconstitutional during her tenure; recounts how she rationalized the decision, which led to a conservative backlash that resulted in her losing a retention vote. Drawing (M)
lead_paragraph: DES MOINES WE tend to think of people who play pivotal roles in the advancement of social justice -- and who pay steep prices for it -- as passionate advocates with intense connections to their cause. We imagine them as crusaders.
